result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie Angel Michelle Scholze was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Complete sex offender assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

superAgency.name: County
superAgency.notes: 12/12/2018 - New Diversion Agreement filed with the agreement to terminate on January 20, 2021.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

Defendant shall undergo sex offender assessment within 60 days of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court and shall follow through with any treatment that may be recommended within 9 months of the acceptance of the agreement by the Court. *New agreement filed 12/12/2018 indicates defendant shall follow through with any treatment that may be recommended by July 1, 2020.

Defendant shall abide by all the rules of Probation & Parole.  The agreement may be revoked if the defendant violates any rules of Probation & Parole, regardless of what action Probation & Parole may take. 

Diversion Agreement filed 12/12/2018 replaces the previous Diversion Agreement in 15CF460.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.

timeConds.notes:
Per new Agreement filed 12/12/2018 - defendant shall complete 120 hours of community service by July 1, 2020 and provide the Monroe County Justice Department, Justice Program Coordinator or designee, with verification of said hours.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with 18CF329

supervisions.notes: Defendant eligible for early termination if successful on probation.

miscConds.notes:
Comply with any conditions, no contacts, and assessments per agent.
Complete treatment/counseling as previously ordered on the diversion agreement.
